Canada, US agree Ukraine needs money from Russian assets, Freeland saysCanada and the United States fully agree on the urgent need to move forward with confiscating frozen Russian sovereign assets to help Ukraine, which has recently faced setbacks on the battlefield, Canada's Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland said on Tuesday. Tue, 27 Feb 2024 16:03:56 GMT 3356VDON55MJTA7CIWNWLAQ6VQ https://www.reuters.com/world/canada-us-agree-ukraine-needs-money- Russian-assets-freeland-says-2024-02-27/Promit Mukherjee, Ismail Shakil世界
Spanish ex-minister refuses calls to resign over alleged mask scandalFormer Spanish Transport Minister Jose Luis Abalos on Tuesday refused calls from the ruling Socialist Party (PSOE) to resign as a lawmaker after his assistant was accused of taking bribes to facilitate mask contracts during the COVID pandemic. Tue, 27 Feb 2024 15:24:52 GMT 7K25LDU4BZNT7PNKT3QIRMEI4Y https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/spanish-ex-minister-refuses-calls-resign-over-alleged-mask-scandal-2024-02-27/Reuters世界欧洲
French troops could have non-combat role in Ukraine - ministerFrance's foreign minister on Tuesday sought to clarify comments made by President Emmanuel Macron that Paris could send troops to Ukraine for specific needs, but not to fight in the war against Russia. Tue, 27 Feb 2024 15:23:46 GMT HGC2TER47JJHZLGIW7IRI6QUTU https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/french-troops-could-have-non-combat-role-ukraine-minister-2024-02-27/Reuters世界欧洲
Norway's King Harald in hospital in MalaysiaNorway's King Harald has been hospitalised in Malaysia with an infection, the Norwegian royal household said on Tuesday. Ukraine withdraws from two villages near Avdiivka, military saysUkraine has withdrawn from the villages of Sievierne and Stepove near the eastern town of Avdiika, recently captured by Russian forces, military spokesperson Dmytro Lykhoviy said on Tuesday. Novelist Akunin says Russia has frozen wife's bank assetsRussian novelist Boris Akunin, who lives in Britain and has been accused by Moscow of "justifying terrorism", said on Tuesday that authorities had frozen more than $65,000 in his wife's Russian bank accounts. Brazil police repatriate exotic native animals trafficked to TogoBrazil's federal police and environmental protection agency Ibama have repatriated native parrots and monkeys suspected of having been illegally trafficked to Togo, the force said. Houthis say they can reassess Red Sea attacks if Israeli 'aggression' stopsYemen's Houthis said on Tuesday they could only reconsider their missile and drone attacks on international shipping in the Red Sea once Israel ends its "aggression" in the Gaza Strip. Tue, 27 Feb 2024 14:36:26 GMT 7ANQIP77ABLWDEB3DZLNLLV524 https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/houthis-say-they-can-reassess-red-sea-attacks-if-israeli-aggression-stops-2024-02-27/Jonathan Saul, Mohamad Ghobari世界中东
US hits Iran with new sanctions targeting commanders, shippingThe United States targeted Iranian and Houthi commanders and a vessel that shipped more than $100 million in Iranian commodities to businesses in China in sanctions announced on Tuesday. Tue, 27 Feb 2024 14:35:30 GMT LEG5I36ZBNLERHTU35STSHJYLY https://www.reuters.com/world/us-hits-iran-with-new-sanctions-targeting-commanders-shipping-2024-02-27/Reuters世界
Ukraine names new head of anti-corruption watchdogUkraine on Tuesday approved the new head of a state watchdog responsible for crafting anti-corruption policy, officials said. Europeans rule out sending troops to Ukraine as Russia rebukes MacronGermany, Britain and other European countries said on Tuesday they had no plans to send ground troops to Ukraine, after France hinted at the possibility, and the Kremlin warned that any such move would inevitably lead to conflict between Russia and NATO. Tue, 27 Feb 2024 14:17:46 GMT 5EY6PE6CJFPGZOO34K43JUZJSE https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/europeans-rule-out-sending-troops-ukraine-Russia-rebukes-macron-2024-02-27/Andreas Rinke, Guy Faulconbridge世界欧洲
